ReportSection.name: Instructions
ReportSection.title: End of Year Progress Report: {$project_name}
ReportSection.Static:
{$startDate} - {$endDate}

Network Members are required to submit an end-of-year progress report by April 30, each year. The report is design to capture emerging research findings, knowledge mobilization activities, new partnerships, successes, and opportunities for future improvement.

In addition to this progress report, Network Members are also required to upload a detailed listing of in-kind support from the previous year, along with a copy of the FORM 300 form, using the templates provided by Making the Shift.

This report and corresponding documents are due no later than April 30, 2021, 4 p.m. EST.

ReportSection.name: 1 - Project Information
ReportSection.title: SECTION 1: PROJECT INFORMATION
ReportSection.Static:
Project Name: {$project_name} - {$project_full_name}
Project Theme: {$project_theme}
Principal Investigator: {$project_leaders}
Length of Project: {$project_length}

Does PI identify as a person with lived experience of homelessness? {$item}
ReportSection.Static: Project Start Date: {$project_start} Project End Date: {$project_end}

# of Indigenous community-based agencies and/or governing bodies (e.g., ban councils) {$item}
# of service delivery agencies involved in the project {$item}
# of municipal governments involved in the project {$item}
ReportSection.Static: # of highly-qualified personnel involved in this project (e.g., research assistants, peer advisors, postdoctoral fellows, community partners etc.) {$project_n_hqp}

ReportSection.name: 2 - Project Progress
ReportSection.title: SECTION 2: PROJECT PROGRESS
ReportSection.ReportItem:
2.1 Is your project progressing as planned?

{$item}

Please describe the reason for the delay and the steps that are being taken to complete the project.

{$item}

2.2 Provide a summary of how your project is progressing, according to each of the categories listed below:

Research Project Activities Progress Over the Last Year
Obtaining Ethics Approval
(E.g., preparation, submission and approval of the REB package) 		{$item}

Collecting Data
(e.g., methods, processes, and procedures used for data collection) {$item}

Analyzing Data
(E.g., Software, frameworks, etc. used to code, analyze, and interpret data.) {$item}

Training and Recruiting Highly Qualified Personnel
(E.g., Recruiting and training research project staff, including research assistants, project coordinators, graduate students and post-doctoral fellows) {$item}

Networking and Partnerships Development
(e.g., Engaging project partners, including – academic partners and non-academic partners, e.g., service-delivery agencies; government; Indigenous partners; and people with lived experiences) {$item}

2.3 What were some of the challenges or barriers your project has encountered this year? What strategies have you used to overcome these challenges?

{$item}

2.4 What were some of the successes and/or opportunities that you project has achieved over the previous year? What steps have taken to celebrate and/or take advantage of these opportunities?

{$item}

2.5 What is the biggest lesson learned over the previous year?

{$item}
ReportSection.Static:
Community Engagement in Research Index (CERI)

2.6 Indicate the extent to which community partner listed below is involved in aspects of your work (on a scale from 1–3):

1 (Community partners do not participate in this activity)
2 (Community partners are consulted on or advise on this activity)
3 (Community partners are actively engaged in this activity as collaborators/co-investigators)

Research activities Service Delivery Agencies Indigenous community-based agencies and/or governing bodies Persons with lived experiences of homelessness Orders of Government Racialized Communities 2SLGBTQIA+ community members

For.array: Grant proposal writing|Background research/literature review|Choosing research methods|Developing sampling procedures|Recruiting study participants|Engaging other research partners|Designing interview and/or survey questions|Collecting primary data|Analyzing collected data|Interpreting study findings|Writing reports and journal articles

ReportSection.name: 3 - Research Impacts
ReportSection.title: SECTION 3: RESEARCH IMPACTS
ReportSection.ReportItem:
3.1 Describe any relevant research findings that have emerged over the last year. Why are these findings relevant to the issue of youth homelessness prevention? In what way do these findings contribute to the youth homelessness prevention evidence base?

{$item}
ReportSection.Static:
3.2 List all peer reviewed publications that were published in the previous year:

Author(s) Publication Name Link DOI Number (if known)

ReportSection.name: 4 - KMb and Impact Plan
ReportSection.title: SECTION 4: KNOWLEDGE MOBILIZATION AND RESEARCH IMPACT PLAN
ReportSection.Static:
Knowledge Mobilization Activities and Impact

4.1 Describe the knowledge mobilization activities you completed in the previous year for each of the end user groups listed below. Also indicate the impact of these activities. Where possible, include links or attachments to these publications, events, tools, reports, training, etc.

You can reference a milestone by writing @milestone title in the text box and a drop-down box will appear below the text box where you can select the one you wish to reference.
End Group Knowledge Mobilization Activities (include links to related materials) Impact (i.e., what happened once the end user group engaged with your KMb materials?)
ReportSection.ReportItem:
4.2 What are some of the knowledge mobilization successes the project has achieved in the previous year?

{$item}

4.3 What are some of the knowledge mobilization barriers or challenges that the project has encountered in the previous year?

{$item}

ReportItem.options: Graphic design (e.g., report layout, infographic design, website design, etc.)|Tailoring messages to key audiences|Hosting KMb planning sessions with stakeholders|KMb focus groups with stakeholders|KMb/Research impact evaluation|Webinar/online event hosting|Blog writing|Research summary creation/design|Social media campaign design|Online facilitation|Other

ReportSection.ReportItem:
4.4 What knowledge mobilization outputs might you need MtS’s support within the next six months?

{$item}
Other: {$item}

ReportItem.options: Live webinar presentations (webinars are presentations on a specific topic featuring a guest speaker and a Q&A session)|Live web-workshops (web-workshops are interactive sessions on a specific topic that involve sharing of practical tools, methods or strategies and provide participants with an opportunity to apply tools and template during small group work)|Webinar and workshops recordings|Web-exchange sessions with other researchers (web-exchange sessions feature one or two presenters sharing a story illustrating a specific topic/challenge and a group dialogue involving other participants sharing their experiences and insights in relation to the featured topic)|Co-creation workshops (topic-focused sessions tailored to the needs of the project team, e.g. evaluation planning, strategic planning, consensus building, product design, etc. and facilitated by MtS/COH staff with an appropriate level of expertise)|Individual coaching sessions with MtS KMb and Communications staff (one-on-one consultations on a specific issue, e.g. online facilitation, partnership building, etc)|Curated online content (a collection of resources on a broad range of topics in the context of youth homelessness prevention research)|Other

ReportSection.ReportItem:
4.5 Ideally how would you like us to deliver our support to you?

{$item}
Other: {$item}

ReportSection.name: 5 - Community Engagement
ReportSection.title: SECTION 5: COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Working with Persons with Lived Experience of Homelessness

5.1 Please indicate how you have engaged persons with lived experience of homelessness within over the last year.

{$item}

5.2 What activities do you have planned in the next year, to involve persons with lived experience of homelessness?

{$item}

ReportItem.options: One-on-one advice for how best to engage individuals with lived experience|Downloadable toolkits for best practices|Advice for how to structure a research projects to ensure lived expertise is at the heart of the project|Webinars about best practices for hiring and training scholars with lived experience|Best practice guidance for compensating project partners with lived experience of homelessness

ReportSection.ReportItem:
5.3 What kind of support or advice might you want from the Making the Shift Scholars with Lived Experience Network (LivEx) – check all that apply:

{$item}

Partnership Development

5.4 Describe the activities and/or initiatives you have engaged in the previous year to strengthen partnerships with other researchers, community partners, service organizations, and Indigenous partners.

{$item}
